items.headline: Big-name strategist Ed Yardeni said gold would top $4,000 by year-end. He was right. Here’s what he foresees in 2026.
items.summary_en: On what’s looking like another record day for precious metals, Yardeni Research is now saying will reach $6,000 by the end of 2026.
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: ‘I’m terrified I’ll be homeless when my husband, 76, stops working’: We only have $100K. What happens to people like us?
items.summary_en: “I’m sick of reading how many millions everyone has.”
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: China has been open to Western consumer brands for decades. Those brands still have a lot to learn about Chinese consumers.
items.summary_en: Domestic rivals are moving faster, consumers are trading down, and global brands from Starbucks to Costa to Häagen-Dazs are scrambling to adapt — and paying the price when they don’t.
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: Social Security says its phone service is getting better — but watchdogs warn callback wait times can run over an hour
items.summary_en: The Social Security Administration Office of Inspector General said the agency’s average speed of answer was only seven minutes in September.
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: Quantum stocks are where AI was five years ago. These bets could be big winners.
items.summary_en: The Pentagon sees quantum computing as a new Manhattan Project. China is “nanoseconds” behind. And these stocks are still cheap.
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: These are the catalysts to reignite stock market momentum in 2026, says UBS
items.summary_en: UBS Wealth Management has a 7,700 target for the S&P 500 by the end of 2026.

items.headline: ‘It’s a heavy, heavy load’ helping aging parents who live far away. Here’s how you can make it work.

items.headline: Rising prices and weight-loss drugs are changing the way we eat — and food companies are racing to keep up
items.summary_en: A shaky economy, wider adoption of weight-loss drugs, and changing tastes seem to conspire against some food makers.

items.headline: ‘He never asks for anything’: I’m 61 with a $1.5 million 401(k). My girlfriend says I do too much for my son, 28. Is she right?
items.summary_en: “I recently gave him $20,000 for a newer car and had him finance the rest.”
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: ‘I would like to give her a head start in life’: My house rose in value by $500K. Do I gift it to my daughter at a bargain price?
items.summary_en: “I would sell it to her for enough to allow me to pay cash for a much smaller condo.”
